alert.note: Alert for Minnehaha (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:00PM MDT until further notice by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Lincoln, Union and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lincoln, Minnehaha and Lyon Counties. Medary Creek near Medary affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lincoln, Sioux and Lyon Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, some agricultural land between 60th Street North and Interstate 90 begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 12.2 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Big Sioux River Sioux Falls I-9 12.0 13.3 Tue 9 pm 12.7 12.5 12.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon.
